intro: Uraspermum barbatum, commonly known as the bearded uraspermum, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves with a velvety texture. Its flowers are typically pink or purple, with five petals and a prominent central stigma. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
